intro: Cephaelis biternata, commonly known as the three-leaved celandine, is a flowering plant native to the western Himalayas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
